translation.Single page view mode: TODO SV Single page view mode
translation.clickOnPageHint: TODO SV You can click on the page number to enter it manually
translation.scaleWithMouseHint: TODO SV You also can scale page using Ctrl + MouseWheel

initialScreen.welcomeFmt: TODO SV DjVu.js Viewer v. %(viewerVersion)s welcomes you!
initialScreen.youCanOpenLinks: TODO SV Now you can open links to .djvu files automatically (with a click) when the corresponding option is enabled.
initialScreen.tryToClickLinkFmt: TODO SV Just try to click the link "%(linkToSampleDjvuFile)s" with the option enabled and disabled to understand what it is about.
initialScreen.chromeExtensionFmt: TODO SV The Google Chrome's version of the extension allows to open local files by a browser directly (via a double-click). But you have to enable the %(allowAccessToFileUrls)s option on the extension's options page. Otherwise, the feature won't work.
initialScreen.Allow access to file URLs: TODO SV Allow access to file URLs
initialScreen.clickHelpButtonFmt: TODO SV Click the %(helpButton)s button to learn more about the application.

helpScreen.productInfoFmt: TODO SV DjVu.js Viewer v. %(viewerVersion)s powered by DjVu.js v. %(djvuLibraryVersion)s)
helpScreen.appDescription: TODO SV The application for viewing .djvu files in the browser.
helpScreen.fellFreeWriteToAuthorAboutProblemFmt: TODO SV If something isn't working properly feel free to write about the problem to %(mailToAuthorLink)s.
helpScreen.officialWebSiteFmt: TODO SV The official website is %(officialWebSiteLink)s.
helpScreen.sourceCodeAvailableOnFmt: TODO SV The source code is available on %(githubLink)s.
helpScreen.go to the previous page: TODO SV go to the previous page
helpScreen.go to the next page: TODO SV go to the next page
helpScreen.fullPageModeFmt: TODO SV Buttons %(expandIcon)s and %(compressIcon)s are used to switch the viewer to full page mode and back.
helpScreen.fullPageHasNoEffectInBrowserExtension: TODO SV If you are using the browser extension these buttons will cause no effect since the viewer takes the whole page by default.
